that's good part of the reason I have
faith in the Mickey and the Dove duo is
that I think what they're doing is just
so universal I mean who doesn't like
lushly colored production passionate
lead vocals and catchy hooks except
fuddy-duddies these guys have the

a more simplistic approach or you know
more experimental or dramatic approach
and still kind of come out on top
like the opener on here tomorrow so many
synth
textures on that track especially on the
hook which makes this track just such a
a grandiose introduction because the
chorus on this thing is just an
explosion that you believe of sounds
it's a rainbow orgasm in my years going
further left-field as the track gentle
roar which is kind of a spot where the
synthesizers take a bit of a break and
you just get this really primal fat
heavy rhythm matched up with all of
these multitrack vocals making it
somewhat of a chant in a way again Nicki
and the Dove no problem can do dramatic
and strange but they do straightforward
really well - like with the track in
your eyes which two meters has really
seductive qualities the sense glisten
like an ice sculpture and it has a
really danceable beat and groove to it
that for some reason kind of reminds me
of the 70s maybe disco it's not
completely something that I can put my
finger on whether is the rhythm itself
or the chord progression but it's there
for me but still as Nicki in the dove is
being pretty direct on this track they
are still finding ways to work in weird
sounds and effects like the bridge which
is which is very very subtle and quiet
almost ambient with all these twinkling
acoustic sounds on it and the intro also
features those sounds as well Nicki and
the Dove definitely approaches these
different angles with some nice contrast
between the verses and the choruses
some decent hooks but I'm not completely
impressed with every one of their songs
throughout some songs really strike me
as having some pretty corny lyrics most
notably the beach and the tracks the
drummer and DJ ease my mind too
but the thing is those two tracks take
an overtly electro approach with the
production which kind of takes me out of
the general musical theme of the other
tracks which makes this album as a whole
feel kind of disjointed because most of
the time Nikki in the dev are switching
back and forth between embracing the
knife and little dragon as inspirations
for their songs when it comes to
production vocal delivery or songwriting
style and I feel like Nikki and the dub
doesn't always apply these influences to
the best of their abilities like on the
track love to the test which is a pretty
nice song when we're breaking down
melody and lyrics it's kind of a tender
ballad but vocally it's delivered with
this wailing Karen drear Andersson esque
vocal style and I'm not really sure it
fits the theme of the song so really
that's kind of the only other major
thing I can fault this LP on it doesn't
really come forward with its own sound
or direction if you've already heard the
knife little dragon or even that I am mi
Who am I album that dropped earlier this
year I'm not completely sure this album
is going to bring anything new to you
maybe there are poppier moments here and
there maybe there are moments that feel
a little more lush but it's not like the
songwriting was so memorable and the
ambition was so immense that I was
consistently impressed with this LP
especially around the last third of this
album where I think Nicky and the Dove
pretty much stopped adding variety it's
actually kind of weird I feel like the
production on that last third of this LP
is kind of different - it feels less
lush and colorful than the nine or so
songs that come before it it's kind of
like listening to an entirely different
release that was just tagged on to the
back end of this thing I know for the
most part this album is just
culmination of tracks that pre-existed
this release but I don't really feel
like that should be so apparent that it
kind of ruins the flow of the album so
I'm kind of feeling too light too decent
